recommendation: Remove threat artifacts; patch exploited vulnerabilities; validate clean state before restoration.
Develop containment playbooks; isolate affected systems rapidly; preserve evidence.
Maintain and test an incident response plan; include contact lists and escalation procedures.
Define communication templates and channels for incident notification; designate spokespersons.
Document recovery procedures; test backup restoration; define RTO/RPO targets.
Provide regular status updates during recovery; document lessons learned post-incident.

csf_subcategory_name: Networks are protected from unauthorized access
recommendation: Implement network segmentation; enforce firewall rules; disable unnecessary services and ports.
Implement 3-2-1 backup strategy; test restoration quarterly; store backups offline or immutable.
Enforce TLS 1.2+ for all network communications; disable insecure protocols.
Enable full-disk encryption on endpoints; encrypt sensitive data in databases and storage.
Require authentication for all administrative interfaces; eliminate anonymous access.
Enforce strong password policies; implement MFA for all privileged and remote access.
Use risk scoring (likelihood Ã— impact) to prioritize remediation efforts.
Schedule regular vulnerability scans and maintain a vulnerability register with remediation status.
Classify assets by business impact (critical/high/medium/low) and apply protection accordingly.

csf_subcategory_name: Software and systems inventories are maintained
recommendation: Track all software installations including versions; flag unauthorized or end-of-life software.
Maintain an up-to-date hardware asset inventory including all endpoints and network devices.

csf_subcategory_name: Supply chain risk management program is established
recommendation: Maintain a vendor inventory with security requirements in contracts and periodic reviews.

csf_subcategory_name: Organizational leadership is responsible for cybersecurity risk
recommendation: Assign explicit cybersecurity ownership to a named individual or role with documented authority.
Document risk appetite and tolerance statements; review quarterly with leadership.

csf_subcategory_name: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is established
recommendation: Define and document a cybersecurity policy approved by leadership and communicated to all staff.

csf_subcategory_name: Computing systems are monitored for adverse events
recommendation: Enable endpoint detection; monitor for unauthorized changes; correlate with vulnerability data.

csf_subcategory_name: Networks are monitored for adverse events
recommendation: Deploy network monitoring or IDS; review logs for anomalies; alert on suspicious traffic.

csf_subcategory_name: Incidents are declared when criteria are met
recommendation: Define clear incident criteria (severity thresholds); document declaration process.
Triage alerts within defined SLAs; document analysis findings; escalate as needed.
